content.description:
Short dihedral to slab and then continue up the steep groove above.Has the same start as Dirty Dishes. 

As you walk down the trail it's the first section of wall you pass. The climb is on the furthest right hand side.
Bolted anchor with rings

Work your way up to a wide ledge then proceed up a wandering crack to a funky move where the crack straightens out.

The climb is on the first section of Main Wall you pass as you come down the trail. Start by a big rock directly below the crack above.
Bolted anchor with rings. One bolt just below the first obvious ledge. Cams the rest of the way.

Short dihedral to slab and then up the left angling ramp to anchors. Can be used as access to the top rope climbs above though this climb is often full of dirt and debris so its recommended to take the normal walk around. Great TR for new climbers thou! Has the same start as Cleavage. 

As you walk down the trail it's the first section of wall you pass. The climb is on the furthest right hand side.
Bolted anchor with rings.

Fun climb that takes you up and over a very prominent nose shaped chunk of rock. The first bolt is just above the arete and small piece of gear is nice to protect yourself before you can clip in to prevent a fall. The remainder of the route is well protected with bolts.

The climb is on the first section of Main Wall you pass as you come down the trail. The climb starts on the slab of rock below the arete furthest climbers left.
Bolted anchor with rings. Bolted though a small cam is nice to protect yourself before the first clip.

A nice crack that splits in two around the mid way point and then continues up to the anchors. Easily protected and would be a decent first trad lead for someone looking to get into it.

The climb is on the first section of Main Wall you pass as you come down the trail. Start near the tree stump right next to the wall. Its the climb with the double cracks; as the name would imply.
Bolted anchor with rings. Takes mostly mid-large cams.

Fun mix of crack climbing and slab all in one place. All climbs can be top roped via a trail found between "Main Wall" and "Lone Route Wall'. This wall is separated into two distinct parts by a short trail. This section if for the first section of the wall you pass as you walk from the parking lot.
